item.title: Where to Find Vespoid Shells in Monster Hunter Wilds (Vespoid Location)
item.description:
Once you start to learn how to upgrade your weapons and craft new ones in Monster Hunter Wilds from Gemma, the Blacksmith, you'll realize just how many different types of Trees there are to follow.

In our playthrough of Monster Hunter Wilds , we wanted to get the Sonic Horn 1 (Hunting Horn) in the Vespoid Tree, but lo and behold, you need three Vespoid Shells to forge it. In this guide, we will teach you a super easy way to find Vespoids so that you can craft whatever piece of armor or equipment that requires the insect's resources.

Related
The Polygonal Monsters From the MH Wilds Beta Deserve to Go Down in the Series' History

I can't remember a technical issue that made me laugh as much as the polygon monsters in the MH Wilds open beta tests. Imagine my surprise when a flying potato chip swooped down and attacked the Arkveld I was fighting. It's an unfortunate bug, for sure, but you have to admit, it's pretty funny.

Vespoid Locations in Monster Hunter Wilds

  • Vespoids can easily be found in the Scarlet Forest, specifically Area 6 and Area 8 . If you open your map and scroll around the Forest map, you'll see tiny purple dots --these are monsters. So, look in these areas, pinpoint the Vespoids with a click of the right stick, and your mount will lead you right to their locations. Upon defeat, go up to them and carve them for resources. They can drop the following items in Low Rank:

    • Vespoid Shell
    • Vespoid Wing
    • Monster Fluid
    • Honey

Vespoids have been around since the first Monster Hunter game, and according to the in-game description in Monster Hunter Wilds , they are "Neopterons with paralyzing poison stingers." They are also quite annoying to take down when in the air unless you use Throwing Knives or a weapon that can reach great heights. You can also try using Slinger ammo or Stones.

For a better look at the locations of the Vespoids on the map, make sure to check out the image gallery below!

We're still early in the game, so when we encounter new Environments, we'll be sure to update the Location and Drop info for Vespoids .

FAQ

Q: Where Can I Get Vespoid Shells from in Monster Hunter Wilds?

Vespoids can easily be found in Monster Hunter Wild' s Scarlet Forest, specifically Area 6 and 8.

item.title: Dead by Daylight Fans Spot Goofy Wesker Detail That’s Actually an Homage to Resident Evil
item.description:
Summary

  • Dead by Daylight players noticed Wesker's goofy run, which pays homage to his running style in Resident Evil 5.
  • Reddit users pointed out the animation references Wesker's dash ability in Resident Evil 5 mercenaries mode, except his run in the source material is much faster.
  • Wesker, known as The Mastermind in DbD, is a notable character from the Resident Evil series, notorious for being a Project W test subject.

The Dead by Daylight community has recently banded together to highlight a particularly goofy running animation bestowed upon Albert Wesker, aka The Mastermind, in the asymmetrical horror game. However, Resident Evil fans were quick to point out the detail’s nod to the zombie franchise. Wesker was introduced as a Killer in Dead by Daylight during Chapter 25: Resident Evil: Project W, a DLC released back in August 2022.

Dead by Daylight recently hosted a crossover with Resident Evil , welcoming iconic characters from the Capcom franchise into the special, limited-time gameplay, alongside a new map addition. The event ran between February 10 and February 25, allowing players to control the Killers in 2v8 matches, such as Nemesis and The Mastermind, but fans noticed something off about the latter character that caused laughter to erupt.

Posted on Reddit by dadousPL, a four-second clip was shared on the Dead by Daylight subreddit, showcasing Wesker’s peculiar run through a hallway. The Killer is shown leaning forward while sprinting, but the run is heavy and appears slowed down, which quickly became the butt of players’ jokes. Albert Wesker’s strategies are tricky to learn in Dead by Daylight , but the villain’s dream-like run took his threat level down a notch. One Redditor noted Wesker’s animation matched how they ran while being chased in their dreams, and another fan shared the terrifying thought of The Mastermind performing a Naruto run instead.

Dead by Daylight Players Note Wesker's Funny Run Is a Resident Evil Nod

The main takeaway from the comments section was users’ knowledge of Wesker’s goofy run being an homage to Resident Evil 5 . One Redditor stated the strange animation was a slight homage to Wesker’s sprint in the fifth entry, even though he ran much faster in Capcom’s game. Another comment highlighting the animation specifically references Wesker’s dash ability in Resident Evil 5 ’s mercenaries mode, and it was also believed DbD had to nerf Wesker because his abilities were too overpowering within his source material. Resident Evil 5 is one of the best horror games with revolutionary co-op mechanics, but DbD players also have the game to thank for Wesker’s killer running animation.

Dr. Albert Wesker is a notorious virologist and one of Project W’s test subjects, known for his shady dealings with affiliates of the bio-weapons black market. Wesker appears in several Resident Evil games, including Resident Evil 0 , Revelations 2 , and The Umbrella Chronicles in addition to Resident Evil 5 . Known as The Mastermind in DbD , Wesker harbors the Power of Uroboros and boasts the personal Perks, Superior Anatomy, Awakened Awareness, and Terminus.

item.title: Tough Guardian Bone: Where to Find it in Monster Hunter Wilds
item.description:
In order to craft new weapons in the Weapon Tree in Monster Hunter Wilds , you'll need to collect all sorts of different materials and monster parts.

For my playthrough, we went with the Hunting Horn as a solid secondary weapon, and I wanted to make a Bone Horn III , but I needed two pieces of Tough Guardian Bone . Where is this stuff located, you ask? We'll show you exactly how to find it in this Monster Hunter Wilds Tough Guardian Bone guide.

How to Get Tough Guardian Bone in Monster Hunter Wilds

There's only one place to gather Tough Guardian Bones from: the Ruins of Wyveria , the fifth major biome you will unlock as you progress through your main story missions of Monster Hunter Wilds .

If you open the world map from a Base Camp, you can fast travel to Wyveria's camp and head east to find a very close Bonepile.

Once you approach it, hold the Circle button on PS5 (B on Xbox) to gather the resources from the spot. Just be mindful that you might not get a Tough Guardian Bone on your first try --you might need to visit other Bonepiles in the region if you're unlucky.

Once you're in Wyveria, you can open the map and look for the Bonepiles and then pin them and set a waypoint by clicking in the right stick. We managed to find some other Bonepiles northeast of Area 5 and west of Area 4 . After you use a Bonepile gathering point in Monster Hunter Wilds , the resources should respawn in about 15 minutes . You can hover over the resource on the map, and a timer will appear.

It's also worth pointing out that you might earn Tough Guardian Bones as a reward for completing certain quests, so you'll have other opportunities to collect them if you are not actively seeking them out.

FAQ

Q: Where are Tough Guardian Bones in Monster Hunter Wilds?

You can sometimes get Tough Guardian Bones as a quest reward in Monster Hunter Wilds , but you can find them by searching for Bonepiles in the Ruins of Wyveria.
